alert.note: Alert for Casper Mountain; Green Mountains and Rattlesnake Range; Natrona County Lower Elevations (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 22 at 6:54PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT MUCH OF NATRONA COUNTY... HAZARDS...A area of heavy snow with visibility to less than a quarter mile at times is occurring across Natrona County. This band of heavy snow is producing heavy snow at the rate around 1 to 1 1/2 inches per hour. Roads and highways are slushy to snow packed or will be in the next hour. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 643 PM MDT, an area of moderate to heavy snow was covering much of Natrona County with the heaviest snow across the west and southwest portions of the county. This area of snow was moving northeast between 45 and 55 mph. The snow will end from southwest to northeast, and should end between 9 PM and 10 PM. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... All of Natrona County except the far southeast. This includes Interstate 25 between mile markers 180 and 234. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this band of heavy snow. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&

area.areaDesc: Casper Mountain; Green Mountains and Rattlesnake Range; Natrona County Lower Elevations
